attributes.comment:
As a US Citizen who married an immigrant and is also the mother to an internationally
adopted child, I oppose an increase of this magnitude. Why are fees going up this
much? I can understand if they were to rise along with the cost of living, but why
punish those people who want to come to the US legally or those who live here and
chose international adoption as the method to have a family? All this does is make it
hard for people like me, who as a college student, met and fell in love with an
international student. We were married right after graduation and have been married
for 8 years. With these increases, how would we have afforded all of the (then INS)
forms, as recent college graduates. We have chosed to have a family via international
adoption. While we both work and are contributing members of society, we are middle
class and adoption is already expensive.

Please do not make it even more expensive for people to come to the US legally.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Kelly Keane-Grundell
